strict_connection_not_enabled_non_cloud.message: Strict connection is not enabled for non-cloud requests

ssl_configured_without_configured_urls.description:
Home Assistant detected that SSL has been set up on your instance, however, no custom external internet URL has been set.

This may result in unexpected behavior. Text-to-speech may fail, and integrations may not be able to connect back to your instance correctly.

To address this issue, go to Settings > System > Network; under the "Home Assistant URL" section, configure your new "Internet" and "Local network" addresses that match your new SSL configuration.
ssl_configured_without_configured_urls.title: SSL is configured without an external URL or internal URL

create_temporary_strict_connection_url.description: Create a temporary strict connection URL, which can be used to login on another device.
create_temporary_strict_connection_url.name: Create a temporary strict connection URL
